summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice request for financial information under the Right to Financial Privacy Act, directed to TD Bank N.A., seeking records related to individuals involved in the Epstein case. It includes authorization, purchase order, and receiving report sections with cost details and compliance instructions.

events.title: RFPA Financial Information Request
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY submits a request for financial information under the Right to Financial Privacy Act to TD Bank N.A., seeking records pertaining to individuals involved in the Epstein case.

events.title: Financial Institution Invoice Submission
events.description: TD Bank N.A. signs and submits an invoice for costs associated with searching, processing, and reproducing financial records in response to the RFPA request.

events.title: Records Received by U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office acknowledges receipt of the financial records from TD Bank N.A. in response to the RFPA request.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York submitted a Right to Financial Privacy Act request to TD Bank N.A. on August 19, 2019, seeking financial records of individuals involved in the Epstein investigation.
The request specifies that costs should not exceed $500 without prior approval and includes detailed invoicing requirements for the financial institution.
TD Bank N.A. submitted an invoice on August 27, 2019, for $33.75 covering search, processing, and reproduction costs related to the request.
The U.S. Attorney's Office received the requested records on September 3, 2019, as indicated in the receiving report section of the document.
The document references multiple legal authorities for the request, including administrative subpoenas, search warrants, judicial subpoenas, and grand jury subpoenas.
